thread.title: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney handed transfer advice by Paul Scholes
thread.title_full: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney handed transfer advice by Paul Scholes

author: Ciaran Kelly
title: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney handed transfer advice by Paul Scholes
text:
Sport Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney handed transfer advice by Paul Scholes The Man Utd player has been heavily linked with a move to China after falling out of favour at Old Trafford. Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Mourinho on whether Rooney will go to China Share this video Get Manchester United FC   
Manchester United skipper Wayne Rooney would be 'more suited' to playing in America than China, according to former team-mate Paul Scholes . 
The 31-year-old has been heavily linked with a move away from Old Trafford after losing his place as an undisputed starter under boss Jose Mourinho . 
The Reds' record goalscorer has started just two games in 2017 and has been tipped to be the latest big name to be lured by the riches of the Far East ahead of the Chinese transfer window closing . 
But Scholes, who won five titles and a Champions League trophy with Rooney, feels the Chinese lifestyle would not suit his former team-mate if he decides to move on. 
“It does look like he is going to be going somewhere, I just don’t see China as the right place for him," he told BT Sport. "He’s a family man and I just don’t see him moving everything over there, but obviously it’s the right place to go financially. 
“Whether he’ll go back to Everton for a year or two I don’t know. Whether he will want to stay in England and play for another club in England? Rooney exploded onto the scene at Everton in 2002 
“I think maybe America may be more suited to him, do what Steven Gerrard did, do what David Beckham did, I think the lifestyle will be better over there. 
“But I don’t want to get too far ahead of myself, he’s 31. OK there is good players in this team now, but I hope there is still a bit of fight left in him.” 
Rooney only became the club's record goalscorer last month after a stunning last-minute free-kick against Stoke City. 
And another former team-mate, Roy Keane, believes it would be 'madness' if Rooney moved to China when he is still only 31. Oscar, Carlos Tevez and Ramires all play in China 
"There's no way Wayne Rooney should be going to China," he said on ITV's Champions League highlights show. 
"He can still play football and still play at the top level in England, Germany, Spain, Italy. Madness. 
"Going to China? Madness. He's 31-years of age. There's plenty left yet for Wayne Rooney to do in Europe. I don't think he's short of money is he."
